Question: According to another biographer of him, Neanthes, this person was eighty-four years of age at his death.
Hints: A variety of sources have given accounts of this person's death.
In any case, Xenophon and Aristophanes seem to present a somewhat different portrait of Socrates from the one this person paints.
The trial of Socrates is the central, unifying event of the great this personnic dialogues.
